thread.title: Westman teams shut out of playoff round at WCT event in Winnipeg
thread.title_full: Westman teams shut out of playoff round at WCT event in Winnipeg

title: Westman teams shut out of playoff round at WCT event in Winnipeg
text:
Westman teams shut out of playoff round at WCT event in Winnipeg By: Uncredited Report Error 
Every Westman team failed to qualify for today’s playoff round at the World Curling Tour’s Atkins Women’s Classic in Winnipeg. 
Dauphin’s Lisa Menard went 3-2 at the event and missed the final eight based on its tiebreaking format, while Neepawa’s Terry Ursel and Tina Kozak as well as Brandon’s Tiffany McLean all went 1-4 in their pools. 
Meanwhile, no locals made it to the playoff round at the WCT’s Canad Inns Men’s Classic in Winnipeg. Carberry native Braden Calvert lost all three games he played while former Brandonites Mike McEwen and William Lyburn both fell in the C-side semifinals.
